page.title: 06Miss Rees Webbe-suffragette.
page.content: One of the old ladies who lives at the Grange residential home is{Miss Rees {Webbe.}She is{97}years old.When she was young,women were not allowed to vote. Miss Rees Webbe joined a band of women called the suffragettes.This band of women did not think it was fair that women could not vote so they decided to persuade the government to change their minds.Miss Rees Webbe even threw a brick through the Home Office window -for that she was put in prison for 10 days. While she was in prison they force fed her.They stuck tubes down her neck because she refused to eat. In the end they made the government change their minds and that is why women can vote today.She showed us her photographs and a letter from Mrs. Thatcher.Miss Rees Webbe{died}at the Grange on{Saturday,13th July 1985.
